definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Deputy Director, Legal Affair, State Intellectual Property Office of the PRC.
sentences.chinese: 國家知識產權局條法司副司長。

sentences.english: Deputy Director-General Liu Jianchao of the Information Department hosted the briefing.
sentences.chinese: 新聞司副司長劉建超主持吹風會。

sentences.english: If you want to give more to SJ, please trust K ELFs.
sentences.chinese: 若你希望爲律政司司長付出多一點，請相信韓飯。

sentences.english: Raw materials, the Ministry of Industry, Deputy Secretary Song was recently revealed long beads.
sentences.chinese: 工信部原材料司副司長宋顯珠近日透露。

sentences.english: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 祭司長和長老，挑唆衆人，求釋放巴拉巴，除滅耶穌。

sentences.english: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多對祭司長和衆人說，我查不出這人有什麼罪來。

sentences.english: Which of the followings is not the duty of the HKSAR Financial Secretary?
sentences.chinese: 以下哪項不屬財政司司長之職責？

sentences.english: Joining the election would at least prevent Chief Secretary Donald Tsang Yam-kuen, the frontrunner, being returned unopposed.
sentences.chinese: 參選至少可以阻止大熱門政務司司長曾蔭權自動當選。

sentences.english: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;
sentences.chinese: 但祭司長商議連拉撒路也要殺了。

sentences.english: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.
sentences.chinese: 他原曉得祭司長是因爲嫉妒才把耶穌解了來。

sentences.english: Deputy Director General Liu Jianchao of the Information Department of Chinese Foreign Ministry hosted the briefing.
sentences.chinese: 新聞司副司長劉建超主持了吹風會。

sentences.english: The briefing was chaired by Deputy Director General Liu Jianchao of the Information Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China.
sentences.chinese: 外交部新聞司副司長劉建超主持吹風會。

sentences.english: A basic education of the Ministry of Education deputy director Wang Ding-hua said.
sentences.chinese: 教育部基礎教育一司副司長王定華說。

sentences.english: Qin Gang, Deputy Director-General of the Information Department hosted the briefing in which nearly 100 Chinese and foreign journalists participated.
sentences.chinese: 新聞司副司長秦剛主持吹風會，近百名中外記者出席。

sentences.english: The Chief Secretary was an ideal candidate to be the territory's next Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 政務司司長是下任特首的理想人選。

sentences.english: Kong Quan, Director-General of the Information Department, hosted the seminar.
sentences.chinese: 新聞司司長孔泉主持了研討會。

definition: (political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
head of a (government etc) department/section chief/section head/secretary/minister/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]

Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (abbr. for 中央人民政府駐香港特別行政區聯絡辦公室|中央人民政府驻香港特别行政区联络办公室[Zhong1 yang1 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 fu3 Zhu4 Xiang1 gang3 Te4 bie2 Xing2 zheng4 qu1 Lian2 luo4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]) or the equivalent office in Macao
Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council (abbr. for 國務院港澳事務辦公室|国务院港澳事务办公室[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Gang3 Ao4 Shi4 wu4 Ban4 gong1 shi4])
to ask sb to resign from a post
